title: What is the font in this image?
content:
Hi, this is my first post. I try to identify this font but I’m not sure of my result. I’m not sure if this font are a Goudy or a Beckersville. My big problem is identify the “G”.  
Can you help me?  
tnks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [wfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704193944/http:/typophile.com/files/wfont.jpg) | 23.52 KB |

 [‹ Fat Bodoni (almost like Sahara Bodoni)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704193944/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44915 "Go to previous forum topic") [MacFormat magazine logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704193944/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44960 "Go to next forum topic")
author: terreldavis

comments.content: Not sure but its very close to Times New Roman.

It looks like [Nimbus](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704193944/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/nimbus-roman/) (or a lot of look-a-likes).

... Nice Capital spacing — pity the PA kerning messes it up at the end.
